channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9977] Define C interface of HBase Client Asynchronous APIs
item.summary: Define C interface of HBase Client Asynchronous APIs

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I feel pretty strongly that an async underlying client is the only way that we can have a single client have good performance as the number of regionservers in a cluster comes up. So I propose:

  • An async C++ client
  • An async C client built using the async C++ client
  • An sync C client built using the async C++ client

I think with those things we get everything that is needed with the least amount of code duplication.
Here's a patch that should show how sync and async libraries can be created and what the async lib looks like.
+1, also left a comment on review board.
Thanks for all of the reviews. Now comes the interesting part.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #4785 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/4785/)

Elliott Clark Is there a JIRA umbrella for the C++ (core)?
It looks like HBASE-10168 is for JNI and HBASE-1015 suggests wrapping Thrift.
